dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perky young WAITRESS stands over him, holding a pot of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warm-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On cris

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sets it on the table with a flirtatious smile. He tak it to the register and pays cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris (V.O.) "The future ain't what it used to be." Ever hear that expression?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later, A SECOND CRIS follows the first Cris to t register, repeating his every movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a joke, but it's true. The future changes every time you look at it. Because you looked at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cris 2 pays cash, Cris 1 proceeds into the casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause once you see it, you're different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris 2 follows, literally walking in Cris 1's footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe just a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DRUNK bumps into Cris 1 and spills his Daiquiri on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that changes everything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris 2 -- the real Cris -- follows a moment later and sidesteps the Drunk, who spills his Daiquiri on someone e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got something to do with quantum physics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris 2 reaches the gaming tables and merges with Cris 1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris (V.O.) That's why I stay away from roulette and craps. It only takes a millionth of an ounce to change a roll. Just placing a different bet can throw things off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A roulette ball skitters indecisively between two grooves before settling into one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRIS (v.O.) I've got other rules, too. I don't play against people, like at poker. Only against the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slot machines. Horse racing. Sports games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRIS (v.o.) And my goal isn't to win big. At least not any more. The idea is to go unnoticed so I can keep coming back to the trough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes the MILLION DOLLAR SLOT. Stops, like it's calli out to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRIS (v.o.) So no jackpots. No longshots. No big bets except when I want `em to see me lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris notices a DESPERATE GAMBLER on the verge of tears. Clearly, he's dropped a bundle. Cris approaches him and points to the MILLION DOLLAR SLOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try that one, man. I've got a feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gambler (suspicious) Then you play it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against my religion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris offers the guy a handful of silver dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it, quick, before somebody else gets there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the Gambler dawdles, a MIDWESTERN DOWAGER plants herself at the MEGA-SLOT and starts feeding it dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris sighs and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gambler watches him go, then reacts to BELLS, FLASHIN LIGHTS, and SHRIEKS OF CELEBRATION. The Dowager has hit t MEGA-JACKPOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blackjack section

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris takes a stool at a crowded table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mainly I stick to blackjack. Boring but controllable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris antes up. Cards are dealt. He's got a four showing. Taking a hit, he goes bust with a jack. So in real time, sticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And safe unless they think you're counting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dealer turns over his cards. He's got a king and a de So he has to draw. Pulls the jack. Busted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dealer pays Cris, then presses a button under the tab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banks of video monitors display images from the multitude cameras looking down from above the gaming tables. The SURVEILLANCE SUPERVISOR, HAWKEYE, repositions in response a red light so he can look over a Surveillance Operator's shoulder and study Cris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. office of casino boss - DIFFERENT CASINO - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Stalin-faced CASINO BOSS sits behind his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: casino boss If you don't mind my asking, why does Homeland Security give a damn about who's lucky in Vegas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's talking to Callie Ferris. We recognize her sardonic beauty from the plasma screen in Cris's pre-vision. In person, she's edgy, confident, and impatient with those w aren't as quick as she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Maybe they're more than lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: casino boss Then we handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris I'm not talking about cheating. That's your problem. But if somebody wins consistently and you can't figure out how...Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She answers her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Ferris...I'll be there in fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands, disconnects, and hands the Casino Boss her business card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me, like they did. And try to hold him till I get here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casino boss Yes, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's already out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Video monitor: close on cris

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relaxed. Playing blackjack. The FEMALE DEALER tries not t gawk at him as she deals from a shoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris (o.c.) Nice looking guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: davis (o.c.) I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back: surveillance room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and DAVIS, the casino's dapper CHIEF OF SECURITY, stand behind Hawkeye, the Surveillance Supervisor, and st Cris on various monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Maybe she's in cahoots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: davis He's beaten six dealers in a row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ferriS You're sure he's not counting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hawkeye We've got five decks in the shoe. And he wins more off the top than the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: davis Moves a lot from table to table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a monitor, Cris pockets some of his chips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hawkeye Keeps his stacks short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On another monitor, A COCKTAIL WAITRESS takes orders from players.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your pleasure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grand Dad, rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: davis (shrugs) Not staying here. Pays in cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hawkeye We're running him through face check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ferris watches Cris on the monitor, he becomes still a attentive, as if sensing danger. He squints a little, the we do when we try to remember something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Invite him for a drink. (remembers her manners) If you don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cris signals for another card, TWO BLACK SUITS appear behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: black suit (o.S.) Sir, would you come with us, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris takes in their grim faces. Turns to see two more pai of goons stationed nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty seconds ago

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The COCKTAIL WAITRESS approaches to take Cris' order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your pleasure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time, Cris hurriedly scoops all his chips into his c pocket, jostling the Waitress as he stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scuse me, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hustling away, he glances back just as the first TWO BLAC SUITS reach his stool, but this time it's empty. They loo around. One of them whispers into his mike. The three pai of goons get instructions and split up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracking shot / eye level

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris strides crisply through the casino. Sees another PAI BLACK SUITS, scanning for him. He ducks into the maze of slots. Zigs and zags from aisle to aisle, seemingly at random. A moment after each turn, a Black Suit appears ah behind, or to the side - where they would have spotted Cr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracking shot / high angle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clearer perspective as TWO BLACK SUITS approach Cris' a from different directions. Cris has no way to see them or know they're coming, but at the last moment, he MOVES in between two aisles where neither guard will see him as th pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: surveillance room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis and Hawkeye wince as the Black Suits keep missing t quarry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: davis What's wrong with you guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hawkeye He's right next to you! Aisle 63!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris watches the chase, fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phalanxes of slot machines

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black Suits converge from various directions, in that fak calm fast-walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris studies the gamblers playing the machines nearby, th heads to a particular spot - where he is sure to be spott except that a TEXAS-SIZED MAN repositions himself, blocki the Black Suit's view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Black Suit moves on. Cris shifts to another spot just a different Black Suit arrives at the other end of the ai This time, THREE FRAT BOYS change machines and obscure Cr from his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: surveillance room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis is throwing a fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Davis There! There! He's right there in front of you! Walk toward each other!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris slips away in the shadow of the Frat Boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hawkeye Maybe he's on our frequency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see an earphone on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hawkeye He's heading to the Convention Annex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stands) Give me a headset. I'm going down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Convention annex

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arriving at the foyer, Cris sees Five Meeting Rooms. He squints then decisively enters one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR BLACK SUITS arrive an instant later. Without wasting beat, each of them goes through a different door. All exc the one Cris went through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris re-emerges a moment later and heads back toward the casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casino

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, arriving, adjusts her headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris sees her. Recognizes her from his prevision as the w on the plasma screen. Turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees Cris. Takes off after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris (to head mic) He's heading toward... (reads sign) the Ipanema Grill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security Staff converge on the area. Cris is in plain sig Suddenly a busload of tourists surge in through a door an clog the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris continues into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kitchen area

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing a room service cart, he rolls it in front of him. few steps on, he takes the bottle of OLIVE OIL on the car and pours some in front of one random closed door. Cris t shoves the room service cart down the hall toward an empt intersecting corridor. A Black Suit barrels into the empt intersection just as the cart arrives - and tumbles over Behind Cris, a door swings open; a Black Suit charges out steps precisely into the puddle of poured olive oil - and falls on his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris slips by him, but gets cut off by an arriving group FOUR MORE BLACK SUITS. Big guys. They try to grab him. He evades their grasp almost magically and, like a Shaolin M somehow leverages them into each other until they are in pile on the floor. Cris darts around them into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lobby

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He co-opts a luggage cart that is loaded up for delivery. Rolling it to the left, a Black Suit on that side doesn't him - and moves on. Cris switches to the right side of th card - just as a second Black Suit would have seen him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abandoning the cart, Cris sets off across the lobby in a herky-jerky rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks four quick steps without being seen. Then stops behind a column just as Black Suit 1 turns his way. When Black Suit 1 looks on, Cris resumes his journey, cutting across the lobby at an acute angle. In this way, he avoid being seen by Black Suit 2. Cris now backs up three steps avoids being seen by Black Suit 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By precisely choosing his movements and knowing where his hunters will be looking, Cris achieves something like invisibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last obstacle to daylight is Ferris. She sees him. He makes a run for the door. She dashes after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! I just need to talk to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris grabs a guest's suitcase and keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homeland Security!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guest chases after Cris - and collides with Ferris, knocking her to the ground. Which allows Cris to slip thr a door to the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. Hotel loading dock - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where TWO LAUNDRY DELIVERY MEN are flinging sacks of clot into the back of a truck. Cris steps toward the open tail with a steady pace. As if on cue, both Laundry Guys turn bend to pick up another sack of clothes. Cris walks right them without being noticed -- and climbs into the truck. moment later, the Laundry Guys pivot back around, toss sa of clothes in after Cris, and slam the rear doors. They g in the truck and drive off just as Ferris, Davis, and sev Black Suits arrive to find a cold trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: davis You were right. This guy is a lot more than lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oddly, Ferris seems almost encouraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ferrIS At least now I know he exists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY - las vegas regional OFFICE - nIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris strides purposefully through hallways crowded with people hustling just as urgently as she is. She enters th large ante-room of a bigshot's office and addresses JEANN a civil service secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Jeannie, I have to see him right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeannie He's on with Washington. We just went on Code Orange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris What's the threat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found a dirty bomb in East Vegas. A barrel of C-4 and a kilo of nuclear waste. But we're getting chatter about a dozen more out there somewhere, ready to blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris absorbs the catastrophic news without emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Tell him I have a new source that could help with the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snide) Another remote viewer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris stares her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Have him meet me in imaging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaves without waiting for a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ext. picnic in park - Day

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris and a glowing YOUNG MOTHER hold a BABY BOY. Gazing i the baby's eyes, Cris beams with perfect happiness. He pl with the baby's fingers. The two middle ones are subtly WEBBED BY A PIECE OF SKIN that comes about halfway up the bottom knuckle. The image whites out as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight pours into the back of the truck, revealing Cris lounging on a mound of laundry sacks. He composes himself steps out, nonchalant as James Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CrIS Thanks, guys. Not too heavy on the starch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer simulation

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pursuit of Cris through the casino has been mapped in 3-D visualization. Multiple camera angles have been merge that a single POV seamlessly follows Cris without cutting

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's clear that Cris avoids trouble before he sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: male voice (O.s.) You pulled me out of a conference call with the Secretary to show me a video game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. IMAGING lab - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ERIC WISDOM, 38, stands next to Ferris as they watch the simulation on a flat-screen monitor. Highly competent, solidly masculine, Spencer Tracy to her Hepburn, you can on him in your average emergency. Which this is not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need six men to bring him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on Code Orange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris He could help us find the other bombs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an ultra low probability. None of your "specials" have ever panned out, and this isn't the time to experiment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris steps close to Wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Eric, you saw it. We're flying blind and he's got radar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wisdom steps away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Callie, people are talking. They say I'm only funding your research because we're involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FeRRIS That's because they're....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but they're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I care about you, and I wanted to support you. But there's a limit to what I can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (professional) Look, we analyzed what this ability would look like if it existed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERRIS (cont'd) I went screening for it in a highly scientific way. And now I've identified someone who matches all the indicators. So the next obvious step is to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wisdom Let me do my job! - Christ! Don't you ever quit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (beat) I've got a country to protect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds her both infuriating and irresistible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use your charm on somebody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stalks out of the room, leaving her more thwarted than sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elevated freeway. Driving behind a pick-up truck carry a mattress and box spring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris (v.O.) I'm not God. I don't see everything. Just my own future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext./INT. Cris' car - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris drives an old Camaro, muscle-y but inconspicuous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris (v.O.) To me, it seems normal. The way lightning comes before thunder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris changes lanes to get from behind the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the time, I'm not paying attention. Just making sure I don't step in a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his rearview mirror, Cris sees the mattress fall off t truck, causing an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I get a blast from far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees a plume of smoke in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or I can start with a glimpse of something close and keep pushing on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the next exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usually it's none of my business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns into the parking lot of a bookie shop, THE FINIS LINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. The finish line - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris walks to the counter. Addresses the manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him it's King Midas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. homeland security regional hq - internal security of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TERRY BAINES, plainclothed HEAD OF PROTECTIVE SERVICES fo the Facility, walks down the corridor with three of the better-trained MILITARY POLICE who have been brought in t augment the regular staff of civilian FEDERAL PROTECTIVE SERVICE POLICE. Baines is a handsome former Special Force Lieutenant, early-forties, who takes his work very seriou Ferris runs to catch up with him. He doesn't slow down fo her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry? Terry! - I know you've got your hands full but I was wondering if you might be able to spare a few warm bodies for an outside operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a look. There's some mutual attraction, but a lot of affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're strictly internal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I need your people. Everybody else is assigned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Wisdom know about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suggested it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Baines arches a dubious eyebrow, an intellectual ju analyst, AMANDA, catches up with Ferris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Callie. (corrects herself) Agent Ferris. I've got a face match on your subject. His name is Cris Johnson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris takes Amanda's PRINTOUT and glances at it on the r it's a PHOTO of Cris on a WANTED BULLETIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fERRIS (slows to a stop) Never mind, Terry. Pretty Boy here is wanted for murder in Nevada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hustles off with Amanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smoky office with a big screen tv and a poker table, bu card players. Cris is greeted by GUY, relaxed, profession smartly dressed, mid-forties. He's classier than the join runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy Well, if it isn't the Golden Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look, a hug. A lot of history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy What brings you crawling back to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to cash some chips. - Got tagged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts setting them in stacks on the poker table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You burned through your stash already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been trying to lay low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. State police STATION - dAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer monitor on a desk plays Cris' escape from the casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CavANAUGH (o.s.) That's him. I call him the Road Runner. You know? Beep beep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT. CAVANAUGH, middle-aged hunter type, beer belly but st a menace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris What's he running from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh takes a videocassette from a pile on his messy desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You showed me yours. I'll show you mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops the tape into a VCR. Presses play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Low-quality security camera recording of a liquor store a night. Business is good. FIVE PEOPLE wait in line at the register. Time code reads November 11, 2004. Cris walks i unsteady on his feet. Heads for the beer locker. Pauses. Suddenly runs toward the register at full speed and TACKL CUSTOMER, shoving him hard to the floor. Cris prepares to hold him down, but the tackled man just lies there, a poo blood forming under his head. Cris looks up. The customer are gaping at him, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slurred) He was gonna kill you! You all would'a died!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris sees that they're afraid of him, not the dead man. H runs out. PAUSE TAPE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to scene

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh studies Ferris' reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy finishes counting Cris' chips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy But you of all people. How could you have let it happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the night Donna broke off our engagement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was so drunk I could barely see now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy opens a drawer, takes out a pack of a hundred $100's, counts out an additional sum from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I hope you don't mind. I called Neal to let him know you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, Guy, did you have to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say everything's inevitable, so I guess I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy returns to his antique copper espresso machine and st to make two cups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you can save your breath. Cause I know what you're gonna say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you're aware that Neal is in a serious cash crunch and could lose it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to hear that. But I'm done playing the market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Guy is distracted making espresso, Cris jams the de drawer shut with a penny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neal's got it all worked out. He'll fly you out of the country on his jet. Put you up in style. He pays taxes, totally legal. You get cash, squeaky clean. Half the net. When your share hits fifty mil, you can say "finito"...and it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except last time, Neal didn't take "finito" for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy slams his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need us, asshole! The Law is breathin' down your neck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can stay ahead of `em forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why live that way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't want to be used any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you give a shit as long as you get what you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause what I want is freedom. And you don't get it by giving it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy calms himself and sets an espresso in front of Cris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy it while it lasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris picks up the cup and knocks it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. finish line - Parking lot - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris starts up the car. Notices he's woozy. He prepares t back out. Instead he blacks out -- as Guy and THREE MEN d him out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy's office

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy sets the cup of espresso in front of Cris, who picks up. But Instead of knocking it back, he sets it down and grins cryptically at Guy, who senses something and reache open his top desk drawer - the one Cris pennied shut. Guy can't get it open. Guy reaches under his Racing Form. Fee around. Cris holds up a knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy pulls his arm from under the Racing Form -- spilling cup of espresso that Cris just set down. Guy knows that's a coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mess with somebody who knows your moves before you even think 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris takes his cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jet'll be sold in a week. Then there goes your ticket out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wait for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy You know what I think? I think I know the future better than you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris scoffs as he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. State police STATION - dAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh pours coffee for himself and Ferris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just some gambler. Lives completely off the grid. No bank account. No credit cards. No previous record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris So why'd he do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be a wacko. He'd never met the victim. No connection whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris tries to make sense of it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: feRRIS And in fifteen months, why haven't you caught him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh sighs woefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw. He's got eyes in the back of his head. He can see around corners. I even had him in custody once, and he disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Must be very embarrassing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A painful subject for Cavanaugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is it you want him for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Questioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Stuff that hasn't happened yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh nods knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess Homeland Security trumps liquor store murder. How can I help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. Suburban home - las vegas - niGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tract house, cheap, from the 60's, could be anywhere. Something sad about the place. Cris stands at the door, holding a bag of groceries. IRV, a sick old man, opens th door, wearing a knit cap and pajamas. He's hooked up to a little oxygen tank on wheels. When he sees Cris, his smil crimps the tube in his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing back here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to fix you dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv pulls Cris inside. Closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. irv's house - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace like father and son. The oxygen tube gets in way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what you get from two packs a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CrIS But you quit ten years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was already too late. I just didn't know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes not knowing is better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look where you're headed, pal. The big decisions are over before you even realize you made `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. The finish line - back room - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh and Ferris chat with Guy. This time the poker g is in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CaVANAUGH Any idea where he might be going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy turns to Ferris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a little problem with the IRS. Think I could get some relief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends how helpful you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GuY Oh, I know everything about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Ferris, knowing. She turns to Cavanaugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to speak to him alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy and Ferris sip cappucino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And another thing, no woman ever turns him down, I'm serious. Mainly because he only propositions the ones he knows'll say yes, which is most of `em anyway. But does that make him happy? No. Says he's bored. Never surprised. Has to watch himself die over and over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd he come back to Vegas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't say, but I'm guessin' it's this friend who's dying. An old fart who took him in when he was strung out on drugs. - He's an orphan, ya know. Been on the road since he was ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Irv's house / living room - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is a mess. Piles of newspapers. Old clothes. Cr cleans up as they talk. Irv sits at a table and plays solitaire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want my advice? Get yourself a good lawyer and turn yourself in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I tell `em the truth, you know what happens? I end up with the Feds. - And you know what they do to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make you a secret agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris Don't laugh. They strap me in a chair and make me watch the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan Rather or Peter Jennings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not funny, Irv. That's all I do, day after day, for the rest of my life. Watch the news until I lose my hair and croak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv is moved by Cris' dilemma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv There's no way around it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best I can do is stay away from all of `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv shakes his head with sympathy for Cris' plight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, you've gotta leave the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know, but there's something I gotta do first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris doesn't answer. His gaze is distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris focuses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's coming here. The Fed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris thinks. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's play it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Irv's kitchen - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris makes a lamb roast, studding it with cloves of garli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got the place all picked out. It's called Palau. Three hundred teeny islands in the South Pacific. (places roast in pan) Nothing ever happens there, so there's nothing to foresee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what the hell are you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris puts the roasting pan in the oven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't met her yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then find somebody else!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has to be her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so special about this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the mother of my child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv stops shuffling the cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were shooting blanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess the doctors were wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean to be indelicate, my friend, but how do you know the little bastard is yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got my thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris holds up his hand, revealing that the skin between h two middle fingers is webbed a little higher than normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't understand why you never got that fixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris laughs...then suddenly stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cris She's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks to the door and opens it to discover Ferris stan there, with her finger about to press the doorbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Ferris, come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She regards Cris with appreciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One step ahead of the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cRIS Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She enters. Tries not to be intimidated by his ability or appearance. Sees Irv, watching them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Is there some place we can speak privately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go in the kitchen. I've got a roast in the oven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IrV No, you two stay here. I'll watch the food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once out of Ferris' eyeline, Irv queries Cris with his ha in the shape of a gun. Cris shakes his head, then turns t Ferris - and waits for her to begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wasting your life, Cris. You have the most amazing talent, and you're running from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, people say I could have been a chef.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Don't be cute. There's too much at stake here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her gravity anchors him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now if you say that man in the liquor store was going to shoot five people, I believe you. Why else would you kill a stranger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris guards his reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But no good deed goes unpunished, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERRIS (cont'd) And that's how it's going to be in this world. People will either hate you or want to exploit you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone but you, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can fix your legal problems. More importantly, I can give you a chance to use your gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, it's better if I don't. It's better if I just mind my own business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris looks at him, disapproving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be honest with you, Cris. That's not an option. Your country needs you. And if we don't grab you, somebody else will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's grabbed me yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris You're up against more powerful forces now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lets that sink in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like you to come with me for some testing. Would you be willing to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris's expression grows dark. He looks at Ferris accusing then BOLTS away, toward the KITCHEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris covers his eyes and dives to the floor as STUN GRENA shatter windows and explode with a FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (temporarily blinded) Shit! Cavanaugh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gas grenades follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris scrambles to his feet as a NEVADA POLICE SWAT TEAM bursts through windows and doors, wearing gas masks and goggles, scanning with laser-guided rifles. They find Cri dashing for the back door. Open fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris tumbles, dodges a few bullets, then takes a hit in t shoulder, the back, the leg. Staggers forward. Absorbs do of bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lies there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh steps up to deliver the final shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Irv's house / living room - an hour AGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, you've gotta leave the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know, I've got the place picked out. But there's something I've gotta do first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris doesn't answer. His gaze is distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris focuses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but they're coming for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris takes the pack of cash he got from Guy, pulls out mo than half the bills, and sets them on a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for nurses and stuff, to make things a little easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris shakes his head and embraces Irv.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CrIS You're the only one I could trust. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're both choked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't suppose you've discovered any last minute escape for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I looked, Irv, I really did. I went down every path, every treatment. Sometimes there's just no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. It's okay...Now I can relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A last look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. irv's street - dAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris' approaches his parked Camaro with his key out. CAVANAUGH and SIX TROOPERS spring from hiding, guns train on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera pans to cris

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Irv's back yard, watching this scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. ALLEY BEHIND IRV'S HOUSE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A State Trooper keeps watch, smoking. When he steps on th butt, Cris enters the frame in the background. When the Trooper turns to a wall to piss, Cris crosses the alley, unseen. When Cris passes out of frame, the Trooper finish unaware of what he has missed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. outskirts of vegas - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Route 66-vintage highway with stop lights and tawdry commercial development. Cris stands on the shoulder, thum a ride. Cars and trucks pass without stopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FAST FOWARD through endless traffic until an OLD CHEVROLE pulls over. Cris checks his watch. It's 8:23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris checks his watch. It's 7:57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris (to himself) Twenty-four minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around. Sees a donut shop. Heads toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Irv's house - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh's State Troopers, guns drawn, are searching the place on a hair-trigger, ready to blow away anything that moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need him alive, Cavanaugh. Even if he resists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to Cavanaugh's troopers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cavanaugh grudingly walks off to deliver the message, approaches Ferris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv You'll never catch him. He knows what you're gonna do to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very helpful information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks off, leaving Irv to regret he opened his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. donut shop - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris steps in. Goes to the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CrIS Medium coffee, black, and a glazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he waits, he sees a vague REFLECTION in the GLASS DISP CASE: a SQUARE CROSS, coming into focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puzzled, Cris looks up and around to see the object that' being reflected. He can't find it. Cris turns back to the display case, but the reflection is gone. The DONUT GIRL gives him his order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris takes it, turns, and notices LIZ COOPER sitting by herself at a booth, circling items in the classified sect He recognizes her as the future mother of his future chil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris gazes at her face, which is both childish and mature shy yet indomitable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns, scowling, from the staring stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris approaches Liz and gives her that smile that always works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I join you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (prickly) Yeah, actually I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris seems disconcerted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Donut Girl gives Cris his order. He approaches Liz ag and tries a different opening line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that cruller any good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz looks at him like he's hopeless. He notices that she' reading the used car ads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Donut Girl gives Cris his order. He approaches Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shopping for a car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What business is it of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Donut Girl gives Cris his order. He approaches Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rough day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lIZ I don't want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Donut Girl gives Cris his order. Discouraged after al that rejection, he approaches Liz -- and bobbles his coff spilling it on the floor. He's mortified, but she smiles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Donut Girl gives Cris his order. Now confident he's f the right approach, Cris approaches Liz and deliberately bobbles his coffee. But not in the exact way he did befor When it falls, it splashes on her shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw Christ! Look what you've done!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. I'm a spaz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wipes her shoe with a napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looked like you spilled it on purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. To impress me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sorry. If I could, I'd do it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disgusted, she hands him a stack of paper napkins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches as he sops up the coffee and carries dripping soggy tissues to the trash. The miserable expression on h face finally wins the smile he's been working for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Donut shop - night - a few minutes later

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're sitting across from each other, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz Divorce, bankruptcy, repossession. Yeah, I'd call that a bad year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Liz, your luck's about to change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You met me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what are you, a leprechaun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An angel, actually. And we always reward the people who help us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, what do I have to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris glances outside and sees the old Chevrolet drive by without stopping. He checks his watch. It's 8:23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I could use a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows she shouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. JEEP CHEROKEE / on highway - nIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going fast. Johnny Cash on the CD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When does the luck kick in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It already has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even a tingle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son, I haven't had a tingle in eight months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits for the other shoe to drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz (can't hold it in) Since my worthless no-good dickhead of a husband ran out on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you're way overdue. For a reversal of fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brake lights flare on the cars ahead. They pass an exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty. (off his look) I teach fifth grade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean of your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that's good. Considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that was the problem. - I couldn't get pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traffic is backed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't mean to pry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't. I'm just running off at the mouth. - That's why I was in Vegas. To see another doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashing yellow lights - a barricade. Cris is getting nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't want to adopt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he had to have a Randy Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashing blue lights - parked cop cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, is there an accident?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is crawling with state troopers. Cris is lookin around for a way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: one MINUTE EARLIER - one mile back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When does the luck kick in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It already has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brake lights flare on the cars ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent) Take this exit. Quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just take it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dotted lines on the road are now solid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it's not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris grabs the steering wheel and jerks it to the right, sending them over some speed bumps onto the off ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go! Are you out of your mind?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slams on the brakes and they screech to a stop on the right shoulder of the exit ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris scrambles for an explanation. Looks, sees a quieu of brake lights from the roadblock now backed up past the ex

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traffic was piling up. You didn't see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET OUT!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could'a been stuck there for hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a flyin' goddamn! You don't grab the steering wheel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris pauses for a beat. Takes a different tack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. I'm sorry. I panicked. I get phobic sitting in traffic. It won't happen again, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn straight, cause you won't be in the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waits for him to exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout at the next gas station? Please. I'll fill up your tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz sighs, exasperated, and continues down the exit ramp, passing a sign that says, WELCOME TO CALIFORNIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ext. road block - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh and Ferris drink coffee as troopers examine eve passing vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris You're wasting time here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CaVANAUGH How long have you been in law enforcement? About six months?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long enough to know we're not gonna catch him by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you think he's got some kind of radar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting idea. It'd explain a whole lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Area 51 would explain my missing tennis shoes. But that doesn't mean they're on a flying saucer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris comes to a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this case, it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh knows he's about to hear something wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. Gas station/mini-mart - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gasoline flowing. Liz, still in a snit, sits impatiently behind the wheel, watching in the mirror as Cris crosses behind the car and knocks on her window. Grudgingly, she lowers it. He holds out a lottery card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am really really really really sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indulging him, she takes it. When he walks away, she deig to look at it. She tries to resist but can't. Gets out a nickel and scratches the card. Wins $250. What the...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHUNK. The pump shuts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris takes out the nozzle and twists on the cap. Behind h Liz strides by in a huff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz Get in the car. I'll be back in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris smiles to himself as she proceeds toward the mini-ma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: exT. roadblock - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh considers what Ferris has just told him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd call your proof a little iffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, from your own experience, this guy can't be punched, shot, surprised, captured, or confined. So either he's got something special, or you're an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh doesn't like her logic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's say I'm not an idiot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm not saying you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to think like he does. We've got to think ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. liz's CAR ON a mountain ROAD - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie Nelson on the CD player. Liz holds an Icee in one while Cris feeds her Kettle Chips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But lately I've been traveling all around Oregon. It's really peaceful up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'm starting getting the picture. - Basically, you're a no- good, worthless ramblin' man who's never held a job in life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's charmed, in spite of herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: liz At least you're honest about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. Liz's car - Outskirts of tahoe - nIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris and Liz sing along with Patsy Cline on the radio. Th song ends as they hit the city limits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where I turn into town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thanks for the ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're both reluctant to part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cRIS I don't suppose you'd have time for a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I've gotta teach tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand...Well, see ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps out and starts to close the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe just a quick one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. The silver spur - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cowboy dive. Crowded for a week night. Liz leads Cris to bar where the BARTENDER is washing some glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender Hey, Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the usual and he'll have a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sierra Pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bartender and Liz exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender Two Sierras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he draws two pints, the Bartender leans toward Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BartENDER Randy's been hanging around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not here now, is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bartender nods toward the pool tables, where RANDY, her e plays 8-ball with a pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Cris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta split. My ex is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris lays some money on the bar, and they head for the do But before they get there, Randy sees Liz and bounds afte her, holding a pool cue. He's much bigger and taller than Cris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy I gotta talk to you, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Randy. I'll call you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to slide by him. Randy blocks the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy Bullshit. I've left a dozen messages on your phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris steps between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris Excuse me. We were just leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy And who the hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris stands his ground. Locks eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz Don't mess with him, Cris. He used to play hockey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy Then don't get between me and my woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not yours anymore, asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy Baby, I've made a terrible mistake, and I just want to undo all the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy holds Liz by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: liz Let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still care for me, I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz resists. Cris grips Randy's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy hauls off to slug Cris. Cris easily ducks the blow answers with a solid punch to the belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy recovers and realizes he's up against a skilled opponent. He takes a stance, ready to get serious. He sti a few jabs at Cris, who easily slips from each one, like saw them coming a mile away. Randy goes for a hook. Cris feints and lands an uppercut to Randy's chin. Most men wo go down, but Randy is so big, he stays up to take more punishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris delivers an elegant beating that humiliates the big and makes him look like an oaf. Cris puts an end to it by breaking Randy's nose. The big guy falls to his knees, bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz rushes to Randy's side, holding her ex and glowering at Cris like he's a sadistic brute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here! Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris realizes he's blown it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still care for me, I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz resists. Cris grips Randy's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy hauls off to slug Cris, who this time makes no effo to duck. WHAM! Cris takes a sledgehammer in the mouth. Ra follows up mercilessly, punching Cris in the gut, then holding him up while he punches him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz grabs Randy's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Randy! Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy flings her aside and finishes up   with a solid rig Cris' jaw, that puts him on the floor.   Randy pulls back leg for a pointy-booted cowboy kick to   the ribs, when L rushes to Cris' side and glowers up at   Randy like he's sadistic brute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here! Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy realizes he's blown it -- and lets himself be pulle out of the bar by a couple of buddies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz examines Cris with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, I'll take you to the emergency room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ho'pital. I don' nee' ho'pital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I hate that bastard...Will somebody get some ice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She strokes Cris' hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. Liz's cottage - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the foothills. Liz's car pulls up. Cris gets out, hold a dish towel full of ice to his jaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I'm causing you all this trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? You stood up for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I wasn't standing for that long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz unlocks the front door. Turns on the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry it's so cold in here. The heater's broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Liz's cottage - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris looks around, sore but pleased that he has managed t stay in Liz's company. The place is cozy, ranch-like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really should've left him a long time ago. God knows he deserved it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause I don't leave. I never have. My boyfriends always left me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wets a washcloth with hot water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get attached to people, and then I'll put up with anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a terrible quality. You're too loyal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She returns with a wet washcloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit in the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lowers himself onto the sofa next to the table lamp. S comes close and gingerly wipes the blood from his nose an lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never minded that I was the more devoted one. Somebody's gotta be more this or more that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they never appreciate it, that you're there for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to stay on task but gets drawn in by his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just try and get away with more and more, and figure you'll just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans forward. Their lips touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets more intense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then abruptly, she shies away, freaked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, I don't even know you. I have no idea who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wipes the blood from his nose and lips. He looks in h eyes. She tries to stay on task, but she gets drawn in by gaze. He leans forward. Their lips almost touch. But this time, Cris pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz is embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to get you caught up in my soap opera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once you start watching, it's hard not to get involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes back to tending his wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever been married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wanted kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you didn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRIs No, I did, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that...I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about his revelation unsettles her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you telling me this? These personal details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You asked and...I guess I felt like you'd understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears well up in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lIZ I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris looks at her with sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lIZ I can't either. Have kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris comforts her. She looks up into his eyes expectantly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fighting the pull, he looks away for a moment to see wher this is going - then glances back at her, almost dizzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LiZ What was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her with a quiet intensity that quickly ignites

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their lovemaking unfolds as it would be experienced by Cr Effect before cause. The pleasure, then the gesture that elicits it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris explores her body until she sighs, then snapsback an goes directly to the sweet spot. He strings together a perfect melody of shudders and moans, without striking an false notes along the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments are superimposed, diaphonous, played against each other in counterpoint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visual harmonics, elastically out-of-sync. Rising to a crescendo. Until all the futures resolve into a single no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AFTERWARDS - nIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floating in bed. Her head on his chest. His eyes open, sa content, like he wishes he could stop time here forever. he's afraid it will all disappear if he takes his eyes of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was...I've never...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris forces himself to look away into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: int. WISDOM'S OFFICE / federal facility - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wisdom, exhausted, quietly confers with a cadre of ANALYS AND OPERATIVES. Their voices are confident, but their bod language betrays their pessimism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: expert 1 We sent the payload to Livermore, and by measuring the cesium degradation, they've identified the reactor in Smerlensk that it came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: expert 2 Washington has our birds tracking for that radiation signature in key cities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris slips in and takes an empty chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wisdom What do we know about the explosive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Expert 3 Our lab downstairs is still studying the C-4 sample. It's Czech, but we haven't nailed down the batch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wisdom rubs his forehead, distraught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So basically we've got nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one disagrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're failing your country, people. You're not trying hard enough. (looks around the table) Do you understand what I'm saying? Do you understand what I expect from you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The staff exchange uncertain glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WisDOM TWIST ARMS! CRACK HEADS! BREAK THE FUCKIN' LAW! BUT DON'T LET THIS HAPPEN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has blown them wide-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly calm) Are there any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. WISDOM'S apartment - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Wisdom are in night gear, getting ready for be She sees that he's disheartened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you're very sexy when you're ruthless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're groping in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My guy's got a flashlight. We just need to bring him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wisdom doesn't have the energy to fight her any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see if Baines can spare some manpower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gracious in victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERRIs You're all the manpower I need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Liz's house - bedroom - morning

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Head on pillow, Liz buds from sleep. Reaches out. Cris is gone. Her eyes open, fearful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes in, looking for Cris. - He's not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears CLANKING from the laundry room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the floor, Cris sits next to the heater, which lies in pieces. He tries to adjust the remaining apparatus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it was broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're not leaving till it's fixed, I'll tell you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles archly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: crIS I'm afraid that could take a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she understands his strategy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as it's done right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. HOMELAND SECURITY - workshop - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris enters the area where weapons are stored and where mechanics build whatever the department needs. She interr Baines as he gives instructions to some MP's. These are h guys who get priority over the civilian Protective Servic Police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FeRRIS Did Wisdom talk to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BaiNES (grudging) What do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him a sketch. He studies it, perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trap for somebody who can see the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands him more sketches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Liz's fifth grade class - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz stands before a map of the Native American tribes of Lake Tahoe region.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what was the main staple of their diet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMARTIE PANTS busts a button to get called on. Instead, L points to a SHY GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shy girl Trout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the lake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. From the rivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. And the Washo were so jealous of their fishing grounds that when other Native Americans came to trade for dried fish, they were only permitted to remain one night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz notices that her students are distracted and giggling She turns to see Cris standing in the doorway, holding a Embarrassed, she blushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIz I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz pulls Cris into the hall, out of sight of the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CrIS (beaming) I brought ice cream sandwiches for everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice cream sandwiches? Do you have any idea how much fat they have in them? Don't you see how overweight half of them are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crestfallen) I - I didn't think of it. - I thought you'd be happy to see me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well next time exercise a little forethought, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
