dialogues.text: Do you want me to leave these somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right then. I'll just go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing his doleful expression, Liz can't help smiling. Sh glances up and down the hall, then kisses him lasciviousl the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put a few in the freezer. I love ice cream sandwiches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a mischievous grin, she ducks back into class, leavi Cris reeling, but exhilarated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: int. CHINESE RESTAURANT - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz and Cris stuff their mouths with lo mein. She sets do her chopsticks, picks up a red pencil and industriously resumes marking up a stack of papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have been such a bad influence. I'm gonna be up all night grading papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris watches, bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a better idea. Run away with me to the South Pacific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny. We've only known each other a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're going to be happy together for the rest of our lives. Really, I peeked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up the chopsticks and takes another bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She muses, tempted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go pack your bags. We'll leave tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what'll we do for money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. That's always been easy for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets lost in the fantasy. He can almost taste the fulfilmment of his dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, first of all, it's the middle of the school year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll replace you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm in charge of science fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can pick up the slack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His unbridled enthusiasm brings out her inner adult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It disturbs me, Cris, that you think it's okay just to duck your responsibilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's taken aback by her sudden shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I - I don't think it's okay. I'm not that kind of person. But I have this feeling, this very strong feeling, that it has to be now. We have to leave soon, or it's not gonna work out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe that. If it's meant to be between two people, somehow it'll happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but sometimes you have to make it happen. You have to seize the opportunity before it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to keep his desperation from showing, but she se right through him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you afraid of, Cris? Why are you running away from yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIZ (cont'd) Whatever it is you're looking for, I don't think you're going to find it on some island, cut off from the rest of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He adores her more than ever, and fears losing her even m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your students are very lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her hand on his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I've got to grade papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. Church - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz and Cris file by the PASTOR after the service and mil about on the lawn with the other congregants. Kids releas pent up energy in the adjacent park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy approaches Cris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy A religious fella, are you? Ready to turn the other jaw?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris offers his profile for hitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then you have to sign the divorce papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LiZ Randy, don't you dare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drags Cris towards a YOUNG COUPLE WITH KIDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz Paul, Janice. Have you met Cris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: approaches RICK, a young LOCAL POLICEMAN who's not the sharpest knife in the drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy There's something weird about that jerk. Have you checked him out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Policeman RICK I'm not dragging the Law into your romantic squabbles, Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy C'mon, Rick, help me out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. church - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul and Janice are chatting with Cris and Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul Cris, are you free on Tuesday? Cause I'd like you to be my guest at the Rotary luncheon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janice I'm the first female member.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris grows distracted. Out the corner of his eye, he sees SPORTS CAR gunning it down the street, passing a SUNDAY DRIVER to beat a red light. At that moment, a kid misses catch and a BASEBALL rolls into a street, where a twenty- WOMAN JOGGER runs over to get it, just as the sports car passes the Sunday driver, sees the jogger, and skids, for A BUS to swerve and plow into a GROUP OF PEOPLE standing the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul Cris, are you free on Tuesday? Cause I'd like you to be my guest at the Rotary luncheon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janice I'm the first female member.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris is spaced out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignoring them, Cris turns toward the street where he saw accident take place. He sees kids, but they're jumping ro Wrong group. He scans around and finds the kids who are playing softball. Someone misses a catch. The ball rolls toward the street. The sports car is now coming fast. The woman jogger sees the errant ball and runs to fetch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CrIS Miss! Lady! Don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's wearing earbuds and can't hear him. He's too far aw to grab her. He's closer to the approaching sports car. C picks up a rock, prepares to throw, hesitates a beat, squints....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws. Misses. Snapback. Throws. Misses. Snapback. Ag Again. Scores a hit. Snapback. Opens his eyes and hurls t stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz and the bystanders watch, appalled, as the rock SHATT the driver side window of the sportscar, which instead of skidding, screeches to a halt. The bus drives by without incident, injuring no one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver of the sportscar bursts from his car and furio charges Cris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CrIS I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I'll pay for the damages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Driver curses Cris and tries to grab and hit him. But Cris deftly deflects the blows so that they seem harmless

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I'll pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realizing he can't land a punch, the Driver changes tack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're damn right you'll pay! I wanna talk to the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need for that. I'll give you cash. Okay? Will you take cash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CriS Two thousand? That should cover it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He digs in his pocket and pulls out the stack of hundreds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON RANDY and POLICEMAN RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who have seen the whole incident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICEMAN riCK I'll run him through the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ext. Park - a minute later

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away from the crowd. Liz, concerned and alienated, walks step to the side of Cris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: criS People shouldn't drive that fast around kids. They shouldn't get away with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you throw rocks at them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do? Wait for people to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz is torn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris...I think you should move on. Today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris looks at her, almost bereft, and makes a tough decis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there's something I've been wanting to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's afraid to hear it. He's afraid to say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ext. another church - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh is milling around after services when his cell phone chirps. He answers, peeved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CaVANAUGH Cavanaugh...No, you were right to call...Ring Ferris and have her meet me there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He closes his cell phone. Turns to his WIFE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CaVANAUGH They've located him near Tahoe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CaVANAUGH's wife If you let him get away again, you may not have a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh takes his leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz reacts to Cris' confession with disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying, you're some sort of prophet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not religious. I just happen to see my life before it happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris, it's sweet that you feel responsible for people. But I think you need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LiZ And I'm...I'm not the one to help you, right now. I've got too much going on in my own life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris can't let her go. He takes a quarter from his pocket hands it to Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes the quarter and flips it. Cris calls it in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks. It's heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flip it again. (calls it in the air) Tails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tails it is, but so what. She flips again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tails. (she looks;flips again) Heads. (she looks, flips again) Tails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks. Amazed. Disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you believe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him like he's the devil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. And I don't want to have anything to do with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz. (follows) Don't you see? I can get us all the money we need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't follow me. Don't talk to me. Get out of my life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks on, leaving Cris bereft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WALKING IN THE PARK - fiVE MINUTES AGO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris What do you want me to do? Wait for people to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris...I think you should move on. Today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris squints, then chooses his words carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Because I care so much about kids that sometimes I overreact?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His words hit the bull's-eye. Liz's whole demeanor soften Although still troubled, she takes his arm, and they walk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ferris (o.s.) Who's the woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. Hillside overlooking park - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, Cavanaugh, and Policeman Rick are each looking through a pair of binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICEMAN rick Liz Cooper. Nice girl, but very erratic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cAVANAUGH Think she'll cooperate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to say. She's impossible to control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Sounds like you've tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's quite a challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. PARK - daY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz and Cris, still walking, holding hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear, I can't figure you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, the feeling is mutual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes you seem mindlessly impulsive. But other times I feel like you're utterly calculating, saying exactly what you think'll push my buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think it's kind of an amazing coincidence that neither of us can have kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to talk to my doctor? I'll get him on the phone. No, really, I mean it. I'll have him send you my records. Because I want you to trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems so sincere that she dismisses her concerns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then open up. Talk to me. Where are you going with your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris seems unprepared for the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: crIS Wherever it takes me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LiZ You never think about the future?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the time. - But mainly how to stay out of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No goals? Dreams? Ambitions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one thing I've ever wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seems disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all? Just a family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was, as they say, left on a doorstep when I was two. (makes light of it) Never found foster parents who could put up with me. - So to me, a family sounds like plenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That certainly pressed her buttons again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to be making this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rests her head on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You poor guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. Hillside overlooking park - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still watching Cris and Liz as the couple get into her ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we get the whole department up here and bust his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris And by that time, his ass'll be long gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why won't he see through your trap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Let's try this one more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ext. old SHOPPING CENTER - daY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grocery, drug store, hardware, gas station. Liz and Cris out of her Jeep. He heads for the grocery store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll meet you inside. I need to pick something up at the drug store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They split up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. Across the street - unmarked car - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, Cavanaugh, and Policeman Rick watch the couple go their separate ways. Ferris gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay in the car. If he sees your shadow, he won't take the bait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CaVANAUGH We hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris I'm serious. This guy can smell your farts before you even eat the beans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rick Miss, I won't even think about beans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris gets out of the car. Cavanaugh and Rick stay put.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick Sounds like a crock to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't been chasing him for three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. DrugSTORE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz is in the female department, trying to choose between various brands when Ferris approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Miss Cooper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Ferris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris shows her badge. Homeland Security. Liz, frightene is ready to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Drug store - dAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Liz huddle in a quiet corner. Liz is in shock what she has just heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not a killer. He needs help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris I agree. But he has a long history of resisting arrest, and the state wants to hunt him down with fifty trigger-happy cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aghast) You're not gonna let them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I came to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll talk to him. I'll try to get him to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris shakes her head lamentably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even his best friend says he'll never turn himself in. - At this stage, there's only one way to keep him from self-destructing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz knows she's facing an agonizing decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris waits impatiently by her Jeep. Liz finally approache carrying a couple of heavy bags filled with wine and booz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: crIS What took so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran into a friend I hadn't seen in a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz holds out a single key on a ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said we could use her cabin up at the peak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris rejoins Cavanaugh and Ferris in Rick's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: caVANAUGH Did you tell her about the future thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Of course not. I wanted her to believe me. - But I loaded her up with liquor, to dim his headlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. Mountain road - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz's Jeep grinds up a steep, winding road, past a sign t says "State Line."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns onto a dirt driveway that leads to a cabin and glorious panorama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, this is gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspired, he kisses her, but she's distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles wanly, then gives him a peck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hops out of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. STAKEOUT SITE across the CANYON - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh and Rick look through binoculars. Ferris peers through a telescope on a tripod. Baines approaches with a half dozen tech and construction guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: baines Okay, when you press the remote, the cabin will lock down like a big jail cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But silently, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unnoticeably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's when we go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris rolls her eyes with exasperation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris You still don't get it. (tries to be patient) This has to be clear to your whole army. (to Baines) And yours. -- After she comes out and we lock down the cabin...We don't do anything. We wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Policeman RICK But if he's already trapped...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, try to think like him. - If the plan is to go in right after he's trapped, he'll see it coming and he'll slip away before he's trapped... (to Cavanaugh) Like he's always done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cavANAUGH How does your plan change anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: baines At least he won't hear it when the trap closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if he doesn't know he's trapped, he can't foresee knowing he's trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That kinda makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eureka moment is when he realizes he's been trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ferriS That's the point. We want to delay "eureka" for as long as possible. So by the time he sees trouble and decides to waltz away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: baines (finally gets it) He's already been in the trap for hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Voila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh and Rick nod with a kind of awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baines looks at her with new respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Cabin bathroom - sunset

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz looks in the mirror, torn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Cabin - parlor - sunset

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris is lighting a fire he has built. Liz drifts in, pens

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris. Do you think we met for a reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, do I believe a higher power brought us together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I think we're just the last in a long chain of accidents that started with the Big Bang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not very romantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but it is. Think of it: For us to meet, everything from the very beginning, every sub-atomic event, every galactic cataclysm, every step of evolution, every act, every accident, every decision in the history of the universe had to happen exactly the way it did just so you and I could be together, right here and now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is moved by his words, but they make her strangely sa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris pours two glasses of Scotch. Hands one to Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To whatever happens next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I went to the drug store. To get a pregnancy test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off his puzzlement, she hands him a small plastic tab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SQUARE CROSS is coming into focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He recognizes the image from the Donut Shop display case before he met Liz for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what this means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other, equally perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea. Unless...But that still doesn't explain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She struggles to make sense of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz, I really did have this problem. I wasn't lying to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't read her reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is good. This is amazing. I want this baby more than anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For both of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lets him hold her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: State Troopers are camped out in two's and three's. Fifty them. Plus Baines' SIX MP's, wearing different uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. cabin - Bedroom - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz and Cris in bed. Her head on his chest. This time he' the one sleeping while she lies awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. STAKEOUT SITE - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Baines sip coffee and wait. They find each oth attractive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: baines Think she'll come through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris shakes her head with certainty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women hate good-looking men. Rejecting them makes us feel powerful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baines And that's more important than love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But she doesn't really love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. cabin - Bedroom - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz eases away from Cris, trying not to wake him. He stirs...but settles back into slumber. She slithers out o bed and tiptoes to the bathroom. Silently closes the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Bathroom - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz stands there in the dark, heart pounding. She sees th the window is open. She looks at it, deciding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. cabin - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning sun on Cris' sleeping face. His foot slides i search of Liz. Not finding her, he opens his eyes. Checks clock. 10:09 AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CriS Liz... Liz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. He walks to the bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locked. He tries to force it. Won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tries the window. Bars across it - that weren't there bef Shakes them. Solidly bolted. Looks outside. No one's arou He's about to shout, but stops himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Runs into the bathroom. Bars over that window, too. As he stands there, trapped, Ferris steps into view outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Cabin - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris' eyes flash open in bed. Liz isn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws off the covers, pauses to scan ahead -- then ru straight to the bathroom and throws open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz is still there, in the dark, facing the open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lying bitch! You betrayed me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She darts for the window and starts to climb through. Cri pulls her back by her robe. She SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bars slide silently into place over the bathroom window, locking them both in. BLINDING LIGHTS spike on throughout forest, converging like javelins at that cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Cabin: MOMENTS EARLIER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris throws open the bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz is still there, in the dark, facing the open window. Seeing the expression on his face, she darts for the wind This time, Cris doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Liz, please, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to you for one minute. I won't hurt you, I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns around, trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris, I know you don't mean to hurt people. But you need help or you're going to keep on hurting them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man I killed was there to rob the store. He was going to panic and shoot five innocent people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I saw them die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like yesterday, with the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were afraid something bad might happen so you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not "might"! Those people died! - They just hadn't died yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His certainty is almost convincing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you hadn't done anything? Have you ever waited to see what would happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trauma replays on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I don't go out much. So I won't be there to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz doesn't know what to believe, but she feels for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. StAKEOUT SITE - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, Cavanaugh, Baines, and Rick are watching through night-vision scopes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's taking so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could just do this the old- fashioned way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. CabiN / bathroom - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz steps toward Cris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris, you're a good man. And I will stand by you through this. But you have to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they catch me, they'll put me in a cell without a trial, and they'll never let me out. They do that, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't let it happen. I'll get you a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly distracted, Cris squints with that faraway gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris...Cris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snaps out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's one decent path. (fixes her gaze) But if we're gonna stay on it, I need you to do exactly what I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can she listen to this madman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you give me one chance? One chance in exchange for a miracle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, Cavanaugh, Baines, and Rick are getting worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: caVANAUGH We can't wait any longer. We've got to go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris looks at Baines, who doesn't encourage her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Wait for my signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. cabin - bathroom - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz listens, dubious, as Cris crouches beneath the window sill, scribbling a note on a scrap of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few steps on, your robe will get caught on a thornbush. You won't be able to get unstuck. Ferris and a tough guy will come help you. She'll say, "You've done your country a great service."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be unpredictable. Surprise works to my advantage. - And read this when you're safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tucks the note into her robe pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will I see you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gathers her courage and steps to the open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: StakEOUT SITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is coiled, waiting for Ferris to give the word. Cavanaugh is on the radio with his men, ready to pass it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris takes a last look through the nightvision binocula That's when Liz climbs awkwardly out of the bathroom wind in her bathrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris She's coming now. (to Cavanaugh) We stay put. Tell them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed, via radio) We stand pat till notified. Don't make a sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Liz is out of the cabin, Ferris activates the remote control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doors lock and bars slide into place almost inaudibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: StakEOUT SITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris shines a flashlight toward Liz, on off. She heads the general direction of the light, but stops BEHIND A TH TRUNKED OAK TREE, which blocks her from their view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEHIND THE OAK tree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris backs out from under Liz's robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: StakEOUT SITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, Cavanaugh, Baines, and Rick shine their flashligh on the oak tree, waiting for Liz to reappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz steps into view from behind the oak tree. Ferris shin the light towards her again. She heads straight toward th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As predicted, the hem of her robe gets caught in the thor She tries to pull free, but she's stuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: StakEOUT SITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Baines wade into the thicket to extricate her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among the thorns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Baines reach Liz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris You've done your country a great service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The predicted words hit her hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why do I feel like a traitor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Baines free her and lead her up the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris scurries away, using the sound of their rustling to cover his escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ext. Forest - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris scurries near a trio of STATE TROOPERS. He steps on twig which SNAPS loudly. PAN BACK to find a SECOND CRIS approaching down the same path. Cris 1 dissolves as Cris steps around the twig and continues undetected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few steps on, Cris 2 slips on mud and slides noisily do slope. PAN BACK to find CRIS 3, who detours onto stepping stones then rejoins the original path, undetected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baines and Ferris help Liz back to their camp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Rick, get her some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz pulls the note from her robe pocket and reads Cris' handwriting: "Then why do I feel like a traitor?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relays a message) We've got movement in the canyon. (to radio) Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flashlight shines up at Cavanaugh from the canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Baines scan their infra-red scopes at the area

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hot human shape hurries over rough terrain with stealth urgency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Baines looking through their scopes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bAINES She told him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tried it your way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Go for it. But I want him alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh picks up the radio with evident satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys, now it's our turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIFTY SEARCHLIGHTS BLAZE ON and stab through the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him alive. Tell them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CaVANAUGH (afterthought, to radio) And the Feds want him alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris urgently takes Baines aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris We need to get to him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spread out through the steep terrain. SEARCHLIGHT BEAMS s over the landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moves erratically, presciently, in bursts, dodging the streaking spots of glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: StakEOUT SITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz is drinking coffee next to Rick's police car. Ferris approaches, coldly knowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've made a very stupid mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust him more than I trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris I wouldn't swallow the "I love you" part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never even met him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I've profiled him for months. And I can tell you this: he doesn't love anybody. How could he? To him, we're not even human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERRIS (cont'd) We're the characters in a videogame, and he's the player with the joystick. We say our lines, and he practices his moves until we do what he wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris on foot, running over rough terrain. State Troopers converging. Searchlight beams crisscrossing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cone of light passes over Cris. Comes back. Finds him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trooper There! I got him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds himself face to face with two Troopers, guns aim straight at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TrooPER 1 Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris tumbles, draws fire, serpentines through the woods, feinting, freezing, unhittable - moving closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: troOPER 2 Take better aim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris is within fighting distance. Chop to an arm. Punch t diaphragm. Cris is now holding Trooper 1's SIX-SHOT REVOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trooper 1 runs. Cris does not fire after him. Instead, he takes aim at a searchlight at a great distance. Squints. fires and scores a direct hit with the first shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns to a second search light. Squints. Squeezes off a second shot. The lamp shatters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ext. Stakeout site - night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baines and Ferris watch as, around the mountain, gunshots sound and searchlights go dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: baines You might be right about this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head) I underestimated him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The searchlight next to her shatters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris gets pinned down behind a tree. A Trooper keeps firi trying to drive him from hiding. Cris boldly comes out fr cover and runs, giving the Trooper a clear shot. But the Trooper runs out of ammo at just that moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trooper Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: StakEOUT SITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching through binoculars, speaking into radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ferriS Be thorough, gentlemen. If you leave a way out, he'll find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baines' well-trained MP's have set up a triangulated trap They operate like skilled Special Forces commandos. One o them signals, fingers to eyes, that he has spotted Cris. enters a clearing and continues straight into the trap! T TEAM LEADER prepares to give the signal to shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris' movement flushes a STAG from the hiding. It knocks one MP and causes another to miss his shot. The Leader se the stag and scans around for Cris. CAMERA repositions to reveal that the stag now stands between Cris and the Lead The Leader shoots the stag, killing him, but not before C dashes to cover in another stand of trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two MP's fire at Cris. But shoot each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEAM leader (to radio) I've got two men down. Friendly fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stakeout site

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, discouraged, comes to a tough decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio and Baines) Change of plans, everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERRIS (cont'd) Try to kill him. Use everything you've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAVANAUGH (o.c.) Is this a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's an order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BaiNES Don't get emotional here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants Baines to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one way to beat this man. He's got to see his own death, and not just maybe. He's got to see himself die again and again and know it's inescapable. And then, maybe, he'll surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: bAINES And if he doesn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be his choice. And he was no use to us anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris is suddenly the target of a turkey shoot. He hops ar like a mountain goat while bullets CHING off rocks and SPLINTER trees. He stays alive, but only by a hair's brea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris finds himself pinned down by Four Troopers. He rushe Trooper One, who fires, and hits Cris solidly in the ches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris rushes the position of Trooper Two. Before he gets there, Cris gets shot in the gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris rushes the Third Trooper, who hesitates, frightened, then shoots -- and misses. Cris charges up to him, knocks shooting arm away, takes his weapon, uses him a shield, t fires at a Fourth Trooper as he charges out from the tree It's Cavanaugh, now covered in blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris uses Trooper Three as a shield, but when Cavanaugh c charging from the trees, Cris DOESN'T FIRE. Instead he sh Trooper Three at Cavanaugh, sending them both tumbling do slope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: StakEOUT SITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another setback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. Fifty men might not be enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow we've got to bring him down to our level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BaINES Got any ideas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm workin' on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris crosses a ridge that leads him into steep ravine. He can't get back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: StakEOUT SITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baines and Ferris listen to the police band. Liz stands nearby. She can hear the patter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's crossed over into Maxwell Gorge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move in fast. Keep him moving. Don't let him rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it hits her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give him time to look ahead. That's the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly making his way through the steep redwood-covered slopes, Cris hears a NOISE. Looks up. Sees a STATE POLICE CRASHING down the cliff across the Gorge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris, catching his breath against a redwood, opens his ey and looks back toward his approaching pursuers. He looks around the gorge, searching for the cliff where he FORESA the SUV come crashing down. He recognizes the rock format across the gorge. He heads in that direction. PAN UP and see that the cliff is directly under the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: StakEOUT SITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baines steps closer to the edge and looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's heading this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, suddenly confident, shouts into the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: feRRIS Cavanaugh! We've got a fox hunt going in Maxwell Gorge, right beneath the stakeout. Throw everybody into it! We need to overload him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz looks around for some way to help. She spots the Stat Police SUV that we saw crashing down the hillside. She sidles toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty Troopers and Six MP's are converging on Cris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FerrIS (o.c.) Gentlemen, if he surrenders, fine, cuff him. But if he even shivers, shoot to kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: StakEOUT SITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz opens the door of the SUV, shifts into neutral, and starts pushing. - It's too heavy to budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris moves toward a field of LARGE BOULDERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: StakEOUT SITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, with great effort, Liz gets the SUV to inch forwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troopers and MP's are closing in on Cris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CaVANAUGH (megaphone) Lie down on your stomach, hands behind your head! You've got ten seconds. Ten seconds and we shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris climbs in among the large boulders, glances up, and waits for the future to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: StakEOUT SITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz gets the SUV onto a slight downslope, and it picks up speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baines and Ferris see the SUV rumbling straight toward th They dive out of the way as the SUV plunges over the ledg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troopers and MP's are advancing toward Cris, about to ope fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your last warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty Troopers and MP's have their fingers on the trigge when the SUV sails over the ledge and plummets straight d towards them. Cris crouches down among the boulders just the SUV crashes on top of him, then tumbles toward his hunters, who scatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris makes a run for it just as the SUV explodes in a fireball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Baines watch the events below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fERRIS Keep after him! Quick! Stay on him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While they are distracted, Liz climbs into the front seat RICK'S POLICE CRUISER, cranks it up, slams into reverse, spins, and takes off down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: baines What the...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fishtails down the twisting mountain road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris practically mud-skis down the slope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troopers and MP's hurtle after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bottom, Cris is carried by momentum onto the CREEK ROAD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the path of A POLICE CAR that comes careening around curve!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz at the wheel. She swerves and slams on the brakes, skidding and screeching to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troopers and MP's slalom onto the road from the incline a rush after Cris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris makes it to the car. Driver's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs in and guns it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting used to miracles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three MP's grab onto the car's mirrors and door handles. weaves violently until they lose their grip and fly off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Rick's Police Cruiser - dawn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz and Cris grin at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea. I was just trying to be unpredictable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAKEOUT SITE - dawn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris urgently unrolls a road map and studies it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Rick's Police Cruiser - dawn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris speeds down the treacherous curves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the plan? Bonnie and Clyde?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CrIS Remember that place in the South Pacific?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's starting to sound really good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll check on our ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. LAS VEGAS PENTHOUSE - daWN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEAL, a 60-ish tycoon with silvery hair, finishes packing expensive suitcase. A high-maintenance SHOWGIRL puts the finishing touches on her make-up in his marble bathroom. Somebody's cell-phone plays the theme from "Peter Gunn." across eight large suitcases, his and hers, ready to go, find Guy on the sofa, watching CNBC financial news. He reaches into a coat pocket and flips open his handset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy signals Neal. This is the call they were expecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy No, the jet's not sold...I'm here with him now...Of course, he's pissed...I can ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a smirk of triumph, he turns to Neal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy He wants to know how soon the jet can be ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neal conceals his evident satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neal I'll wait until eight o'clock. But if he's not there, I'm taking off without him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Rick's Police Cruiser - dawn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris, driving fast on the treacherous winding road, close his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cRIS It's arranged. But we have to get to the North Vegas airport by eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will we make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He concentrates as he screeches around a curve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now I'm just trying to stay alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hit a patch of ice. Skid wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's Police Cruiser swings over the side and tumbles do steep slope. There will be no survivors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on curve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's Police Cruiser speeds into view AGAIN!?? But this time, Cris steers around the ice patch, skids dangerously almost goes over the side, but continues safely downhill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's Police Cruiser

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz, palpitating, tries to catch her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, you live dangerously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the opposite. I never take chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavanaugh's Car speeds into view, skids on the same patch ice and skates over the side of the road, as Cris did, th first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be no survivors. And no second chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a Federal Chopper idles, Ferris marks up a ROAD MAP of area with X's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio) Cavanaugh, get all your men into town. (waits) Cavanaugh? Tell them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baines approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BaINES He's dead. Crashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris winces, then moves on like a general in battle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take command of the chase. (hands him the map) Have cars block these intersection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads over to the copter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He follows her inside, and the copter takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris takes blind curves at high speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did the doctors ever say why you couldn't have kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I grew up at Love Canal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A neighborhood back East built over a chemical dump. A bunch of my friends had birth defects. (looks back) I always figured I was lucky just to be sterile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except you're not. And neither am I. We're different, that's all. We just had to find the right match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And somehow we did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach the entrance to the town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. hendersonville - DAWN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police vehicles converge on the area, systematically bloc the intersections that Ferris indicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's Police Cruiser

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris threads his way through town, zigging and zagging do streets and alleys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris sees Cris maneuvering perfectly through the maze, avoiding imminent traps and confrontation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (discouraged) He doesn't miss a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased, to herself) Come to momma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris dodges another trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to radio) Stay after him. Keep the pressure on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bypassed police cars chase after Rick's stolen Cruise which leaves town on a street that merges with a WINDY NA CANYONSIDE ROAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous) He's driving right into it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, beyond a blind curve, the road leads to a ONE-L BRIDGE over a DEEP CHASM with RAGING RAPIDS at the bottom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes looking one step ahead isn't enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the FAR SIDE OF THE BRIDGE, out of sight, beyond a cur EIGHT STATE POLICE CARS form a barricade across the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Rick's Police Cruiser - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having escaped from town, Cris and Liz share a glimmer of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make it look easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris' expression darkens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I blew it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They round a curve and the NARROW BRIDGE comes into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the barricade, Ferris' helicopter comes in for a landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Rick's Police Cruiser - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris checks his rearview mirror. A six-pack of cop cars a right behind him. To his left, a steep rock wall. To his right, a vertical drop-off into the canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris drives on, the blood draining from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris strides across the span, Baines in her wake. Arriv at the barricade, she approaches the biggest state police car, a HUMMER -- and flashes her badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks through the Trooper and gets into his Hummer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Playing chicken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid! He knows what you'll do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But so do I. And for once, that makes us even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts up the Hummer. It roars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris slams on the brakes. Stops the car. Police cars stop behind him, blocking retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET OUT! NOW! OR YOU'LL DIE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hustles out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LiZ What's going to happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cris We'll find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quick look good-bye and he drives on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris gathers her determination and floors it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A game of chicken with a difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squinting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fast forward to the HEAD ON COLLISION! Then a COLLAGE of ALTERNATE CHOICES AND OUTCOMES: Cris swerves; slams on th brakes; gets shot making a run for the rail; spins out on roadbed; crashes over the side, over the side, over the s But in every version, the Hummer is unchanging. Unrelenti Dead on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're speeding closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Total focus. No doubts or decisions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The falling car crashes onto the canyon wall, tumbles downhill, explodes; falls again, this time crashing direc onto boulders at the bottom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drives toward a specific segment of railing between tw light posts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's Cruiser crashes through the railing and plunges ov the side of the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz runs to the rail and leans over the side, watching th Cruiser fall down, down, down through the narrow ravine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris unbuckles his seat belt. Opens the door. Just before impact, he LEAPS OUT, away from the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car smashes into boulders at the shallow side of the river. A moment later, Cris SPLASHES a few yards away in deepest part of the rapids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris peers down into the canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris bobs to the surface and is carried away by the fierc current. The smashed Cruiser also gets carried into the river. Fighting the current, Cris watches as the smashed police cruiser surges ahead of him - then disappears!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perplexed for a beat, he suddenly understands and despera swims for a rock and clambers onto it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA pulls back to reveal that Cris is stuck in the mid of the river -- about five feet from where it drops off i a WATERFALL!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: flies over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris looks for a way out. Seeing none, he jumps!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And is swallowed up in dark thunderous death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still on the rock. Looks up and sees a cable being lowere from the helicopter. He looks around? Is there another wa out? Out of choices, he reaches for the cable. Misses! Lo his balance. Flails. At the last second, he steadies hims

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cable dangles back into range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cable is hooked to A PAIR OF HANDCUFFS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watches through binoculars as Cris snaps one cuff around wrist -- and waits. She shouts into her radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuffs on both wrists. Leave him if he doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BaiNES What can he do hanging by one arm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baines speaks to Cris via loudspeaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baines Both wrists!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the rock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris, defeated, attaches the second cuff to his other wri He is lifted up into the air, hanging by both arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bridge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liz sits, handcuffed, in the back of a second U.S. Govern helicopter. Ferris approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wrong about one thing. He is capable of love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Descends, with Cris hanging below by a cable. MP's are waiting below with a tarp which they wrap around Cris, th tape him like a mummy, up to his neck. When he's bound as securely as Hannibal Lecter, Ferris steps close and gets first good look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Cris Johnson, we meet at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does everybody have amnesia but me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only ask one thing from you. Give me a chance to earn your trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cris I did, and you failed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seems genuinely surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then give me another chance. You get `em all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She signals and Cris is dumped into the waiting helicopte The door is slammed behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. helicopter - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, Cris is surprised to find himself alone with Liz. edges closer so they can hear each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let them know you're pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CrIS You don't have to raise him. But at least let him be born. Can you do that? It might be the only chance either of us gets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gaze at each other with intense longing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work with them Cris. So we can be together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head, fatalistic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get us out of here. We can still make the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows it's hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ext. HOMELAND SECURITY - VEGAS OFFICE - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming into view by air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ext. HOMELAND SECURITY - MEDICAL LAB - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MED TECHS perform a battery of tests on Cris and Liz. Wis Baines, and Ferris watch through glass in an adjoining ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wisdom Are you out of your mind? Did you ever play chicken before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This game was different. He knew I wouldn't flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baines covertly makes the "big balls" gesture with two cl hands. Wisdom nods knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: baINES What's new with the Code Orange?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's red now. And we're out of leads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fERRIS Then you better hope he's what I say he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, make me a believer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Size of an elevator. Cris stands there, bound ankle and wrist. Click, the metal shackles open automatically and d to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris reaches down for them. Possible weapon. Struggles to lift them. Can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERRIS (o.c.) Electromagnets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Observation room - daY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, Baines, and Wisdom peer down into the White Vesti through a window. Technicians operate a control panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WiSDOM Aren't you being a little over- cautious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not possible with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans forward, flips a toggle. Down below, in the Vestibule, a door slides open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris, please step into the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris gives up on the chains and sullenly steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Size of a squash court. Cris enters gingerly and peers around. Twenty feet up, an OBSERVATION WINDOW, opaque. On other walls, RIFLE BARRELS poke through NARROW SLITS. The door slides shut behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Observation room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris leans forward and speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris, we'll be firing at you with live ammo. Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WisDOM You're shooting your secret weapon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris signals Wisdom to be patient. Cris just stands the flatfooted, arms folded, unafraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris nods. A Techie presses a button. The THREE RIFLES FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris is hit square in the chest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By THREE BLUE PAINTBALLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CrIS You're paying for the shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WisDOM (unconvinced) I hope you've got more than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we are going to use live ammo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on my watch, you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise you, he won't be hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wisdom looks her in the eye. Sees her certainty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your experiment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris leans toward a microphone, but before she can spea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "From now on, Cris, the bullets are real."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris sits back and nods to the techies to proceed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris balances, at the ready, as the three rifles take aim him. He LUNGES at the very instant that one rifle FIRES. bullet ZINGS by his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the second rifle fires, Cris contorts -- and a bullet parts his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the third rifles fires, he tumbles away, almost a blur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More shots, in rapid sequence, erratic rhythm. Two at a t Three at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a pinball, Cris pivots, crouches, dodges every bulle Then suddenly stops. Stands there. An easy target. Click, click, click, the guns are out of bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's almost impossible to shoot, hit, surprise, capture, or contain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I try?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be my guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wisdom takes out his handgun, carefully aims, and dischar six shots at Cris - doesn't score a hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WisDOM How do you know it's prevision? Maybe he's reading minds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris shows the aiming gantries to Wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No minds to read. The guns are aimed automatically by infrared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WiSDOM (impressed) What other tricks can he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris pushes a toggle, and a pocket door slides open in wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ferris (to Cris) Please step into the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going. No need for a hotfoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BaiNES (explains, to Wisdom) The floor is electrified. He must have tried resisting and foreseen the result.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris walks through the doorway into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: which is familiar from the opening sequence, but not exac the same. Because it's not exactly the same future. A HEA CHAIR, bolted to the floor, faces a PLASMA SCREEN MONITOR the wall. To the left of the screen is a MIRROR; to the right, a DIGITAL CLOCK-CALENDAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris' FACE appears on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris on monitor Cris, it's time to get started with the next test. This won't be unpleasant. We just need to you sit in the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris eyes the chair with suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris on monitor I want you to look ahead, tell me the time on the clock and then tell me what film clip you see playing. Let's start with five minutes from now. Then we'll press ahead as far as you're capable of. (to Wisdom) The clips have been assembled at random by a computer, so nobody knows what'll be playing next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris looks into the mirror and sees his face reflected - an old man. He turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cris Look, I'll stand here and tell you what I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris on monitor I'm afraid we need you to sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris on monitor Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris oN MONITOR Tell us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tie me down and never let me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wisdom looks at Ferris. She shrugs, sheepish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FerriS That's only because you won't cooperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're trying to force me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Work with us, Cris, and you can be a hero. Fight us, and things will get worse and worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris squints, frustrated, looking for a way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris ON MONITOR (severe) Now sit in the chair. One. Two. Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris switches the toggle. The sizzle of electricity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris hops and jumps in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris turns away, then makes herself look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, you are one tough bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're still in a Code Red if I'm not mistaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns off the juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew he'd get shocked, but he chose to resist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's almost never had to face consequences. (flips toggle) Cris, are you ready to get in the chair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris, recovering, shoots her the finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She switches the toggle again - and leaves it on. Wisdom doesn't have the stomach to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need information, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cris collapses, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him there. We'll start again when he recovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. Wisdom's office - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wisdom and Ferris are both traumatized by the torture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, how do we use him to find the bombs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simple. We make him watch the news and tell us about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far ahead can he see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But I suspect we can increase his range with practice. Especially if we restrict his future to only watching news. Then he'll be like a timescope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wisdom nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right. This is huge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just for starters. You want to stage a pre-emptive strike, he can tell you if you'll hit the target and whether they hit back and what went wrong. And you can do this over and over until you get it perfect before you begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wisdom chuckles at the enormity of the potential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wisDOM And all he's ever done with it is a little gambling and securities fraud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FeRRIS I know, it's amazing; but he's not ambitious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WiSDOM Damn, how will we control this guy when he figures out what he's capable of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris We control him now. We just have to keep it that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now, sweetheart, we can't even get him to sit in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dread suddenly washes over Wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to think this through. Your friend could be more dangerous than the terrorists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris Aren't you running ahead of yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this guy, you have to. Or it'll be over before it begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris So we'll keep him in chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That may not be enough. We may have to cut off his arms and legs. Then I might start to feel safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris grins uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris You're not serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it. What we're talking about here is the next step in human evolution. And I'm not gonna make the same mistake the Neanderthals made when they ran across this good-looking Homo Sapien fellow and all the lady Neanderthals said, "He's so cute. Let's keep him around."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
